article: Last night, when I was driving back home, I noticed a hitchhiker who was having no luck getting a ride. I rolled down my  _  and signed to the man to my car. I asked him where he was  _  and he told me he needed a  _  to his doctor's office which would close in 15 minutes. I told him to  get in  and he gratefully did so.  As soon as  he got in he told me that he was a  _  and went out to sea for weeks at a time. He took medicine for his nerves and  _  to get another prescription before he left on the boat. He said that he had prayed  _  would stop for him so he could be there before the  _  office closed. With some  _  driving we managed to make it there in about 10  _  . I then asked him how he  _  on getting back home and he said he could walk. "I'll patiently  _  for you and bring you back," I told him. He  _  me and said he should only be about 15 minutes. Afterwards he got back in my  _  and tried his hardest to pay me back: offering me dinner, gas money, even offering to ship me 40 lbs of scallops ! I  _  refused, gave him a smile card and asked him to help someone else the next time he had a  _  . I drove him back to where I had picked him up and  _  one more "thank you" he was on his way. I feel that the universe  _  provides us with what we need. In the man's  _  it was a ride, in mine the opportunity to help someone else.
